title: Why is the American national anthem so hard to sing? - Quora
tags: Culture of the United States of America

response.answer_text: It's a drinking song, originally meant to be belted out with a pint in your hand, amongst a group of your best buds, at the pub. Try that, and you'll find it much easier to sing…

Most songs are about an octave from lowest to highest note. Most people can sing that. The SSB is an octave and a “fifth” which is all the way up the major scale and then four more notes up another scale on top of that. Most people can sing that if they start on their personal lowest note, but what are the chances the version you get at the ball game does that?
